html:
Best Mosquito Repellent to Send to Cuba in Bulk

Look, mosquitoes in Cuba aren't messing around. Between dengue outbreaks making headlines and the everyday reality of getting eaten alive during los apagones when you can't even run a fan—your family needs serious protection. Not the watered-down stuff from the pharmacy shelf. The real deal, in quantities that'll actually last.

Here's what most people don't realize when shopping for repellent to ship: there are fundamentally different approaches here. You've got DEET (the nuclear option—works everywhere on everything), Picaridin (gentler, no plastic-melting issues), Permethrin (treats clothes and gear, not skin), and plant-based options for the chemical-averse. Each has a place depending on who's using it and how.

The Cuban climate makes this trickier than buying for yourself in Miami. Humidity degrades some formulas faster. Sweat washes off others before they've done their job. And your tía who refuses to use "esas cosas químicas" needs something she'll actually apply. So let's break this down by what actually works, what ships well in bulk, and what won't get your package flagged at customs.

Pro tip before we dive in: aerosol cans are technically restricted in some shipping scenarios. Pump sprays and lotions? Zero issues. Keep that in mind as you build your care package.

The Quick Answer

For serious mosquito country—and Cuba qualifies—the Sawyer Permethrin 24oz for treating clothes combined with Repel 100 for exposed skin is unbeatable. Treat clothes once, protection lasts through 6 washes. Your family will thank you during every dusk-to-dawn mosquito assault.

See Sawyer Permethrin on Amazon

The Heavy Hitters: Maximum DEET Protection

Repel 100 Insect Repellent, 4oz Pump

4.6★

$

This is 98% DEET. Not 25%, not 40%—ninety-eight percent. The kind of concentration you need when mosquitoes have developed PhDs in finding exposed ankles. Ten-hour protection means one application covers an entire evening outdoors. The pump spray won't get confiscated like aerosols might, and 4 ounces is substantial enough to last weeks with normal use.

One caveat: DEET at this concentration can damage plastics, synthetic fabrics, and watch crystals. Keep it away from gear. Apply to skin only, and wash hands before touching anything you care about.

VERDICT: The "I refuse to get bitten" option. Worth every penny for anyone spending time outdoors after dark.

Check Price on Amazon

Repel 100 Travel Size, 1oz

4.6★

$

Same 98% DEET formula, pocket-sized. Perfect for distributing—send a few bottles so everyone in the house has their own. Fits in a purse, work bag, or guayabera pocket. Your cousin who takes the guagua to work? This saves them from that daily mosquito gauntlet at the bus stop.

At the $ tier, you can buy several without breaking the bank. The small size also means customs won't look twice.

VERDICT: Buy a bunch. Scatter them across the package. Everyone gets protected.

Check Price on Amazon

Ben's 100 DEET, 3.4oz 2-Pack

4.5★

$$

Here's the thing about Ben's that Repel doesn't advertise: it's alcohol-free. Why does that matter in Cuba? Because high-DEET + alcohol + tropical sun = irritated skin that makes you not want to reapply. Ben's water-based formula goes on gentler, especially important for anyone with sensitive skin or who's out in direct sun all day.

The 2-pack at $$ means you're getting solid value for two 3.4oz bottles. Same 10-hour protection as Repel 100.

VERDICT: The upgrade for anyone who found DEET too harsh. Same protection, gentler delivery.

Check Price on Amazon

The Smart Play: Permethrin for Clothes & Gear

This is the secret weapon most people overlook. Permethrin doesn't go on skin—it treats clothing, mosquito nets, hammocks, even curtains. Spray it on, let it dry, and the treatment lasts through six washes. Mosquitoes that land on treated fabric? Dead in seconds. Combine this with skin repellent and you've built an actual fortress.

Sawyer Permethrin 24oz

4.6★

$$

The sweet spot for families. 24 ounces treats multiple outfits plus a mosquito net. This is enough for a household to treat their most-worn clothes and still have some left over. At the $$ tier, it's genuinely excellent value considering how long one treatment lasts.

VERDICT: Best balance of quantity and cost. Our top pick for sending to Cuba.

Check Price

Sawyer Permethrin 9oz

4.6★

$

Smaller bottle, same formula. Good for treating 2-3 complete outfits or one mosquito net thoroughly. At the $ tier, consider buying multiples to spread across different households if you're sending to extended family. Lighter for shipping too.

VERDICT: Budget-friendly entry point. Buy two if you're unsure about quantity.

Check Price

Sawyer Permethrin Twin Pack (2x 24oz)

4.6★

$$$

Now we're talking bulk. 48 ounces total—enough to treat every piece of outdoor clothing, all the mosquito nets, the curtains near windows without screens, maybe even the hammock on the patio. At $$$ you're paying a premium versus buying singles, but you're also saving on shipping weight per ounce.

If your family is large or spread across multiple houses, this is the move. Split between households and everyone stays protected for months.

VERDICT: The "I want my whole family covered through mosquito season" option.

Check Price on Amazon

The Gentle Alternative: Picaridin Options

Not everyone wants to bathe in DEET. Picaridin offers comparable protection without the plastic-melting properties or harsh chemical smell. It's what the CDC recommends as an alternative, and it won't destroy your sunglasses if you accidentally touch your face. Great for kids, for anyone with sensitive skin, or for people who just don't like how DEET feels.

Sawyer Picaridin Lotion, 4oz

4.5★

$

Lotion format means precise application and zero waste from overspray. 20% Picaridin gives you 12+ hours of protection—actually longer than DEET in some conditions. It absorbs cleanly, doesn't leave that oily residue, and you can apply it like regular lotion without worrying about your watch band or phone case.

Particularly good for the older folks in the family who might find spray formats annoying or wasteful.

VERDICT: Best for abuela and anyone who hates that "repellent feeling."

Check Price on Amazon

Sawyer Picaridin Spray 2-Pack (3oz each)

4.5★

$$

Pump spray format in a convenient 2-pack. Easier to share around the family—one for the main house, one for whoever needs it most. Pump sprays ship without restrictions and won't leak like aerosols sometimes do in transit.

VERDICT: Solid value if you prefer spray over lotion.

Check Price

Sawyer Picaridin Continuous Spray 2-Pack (6oz each)

4.5★

$$

Continuous spray covers more area faster—good for whole-family application when everyone needs to head out. 12 ounces total at the $$ tier represents real value. The larger bottles mean fewer to pack and more protection per shipment.

VERDICT: Best volume-to-value in the Picaridin lineup.

Check Price

The Natural Option & Travel Size

Repel Lemon Eucalyptus 2-Pack (4oz each)

4.4★

$

Plant-based, CDC-recommended, smells like lemon instead of chemicals. Oil of Lemon Eucalyptus (OLE) provides about 6 hours of protection—less than DEET, but perfectly fine for daytime activities. Great for anyone who flat-out refuses synthetic repellents. Just reapply more often.

VERDICT: The choice for the natural-minded. Real protection, no harsh chemicals.

Check Price

OFF! Deep Woods Travel Size, 2.5oz

4.6★

$

The brand everyone recognizes. 25% DEET in a dry, non-greasy aerosol formula. Here's the catch: aerosols can be restricted by some carriers. Check your shipping method first. When it works, this is a great pocket-sized option with a familiar name your family will trust immediately.

VERDICT: A known quantity—just verify shipping compatibility first.
